job_tasks.phrase: improving the current infrastructure landscape by automation
job_tasks.justification: This phrase refers to the ongoing maintenance and enhancement of existing systems through automated processes, which aligns with operational responsibilities in managing infrastructure.
This directly states a core responsibility related to the smooth and efficient running of systems and infrastructure.

job_tasks.phrase: support the team in building and expanding (new) systems and platforms
job_tasks.justification: This describes the task of creating and developing new software systems and platforms, which falls under traditional software development and integration.
This involves modifying and improving current infrastructure, which is a form of software development and integration to upgrade existing systems.

job_tasks.phrase: the infra delivery to our internal customers
job_tasks.justification: This refers to the operational aspect of providing and delivering infrastructure services to internal users, aligning with operational responsibilities.

job_tasks.phrase: carrying out life cycle management of systems and software
job_tasks.justification: This encompasses the entire operational process of managing systems and software from creation to retirement, a key aspect of operations.

soft_skills.phrase: You are responsible for your own development, so you decide how, what and when you develop yourself!
You make sure that your manager and your colleagues know your goals and development requests.
you have to take initiative yourself.
do you miss something or do you see improvement? Go ahead, change it!
Is something missing or could something be better? Go ahead, do it differently.
You are responsible for your own development and you decide how, what and when you learn.

profile.rationale: All identified job tasks fall under Macro-Category A (Core Software Engineering), specifically 1.A.1. Software Development & Integration and 1.A.2. Operations & MLOps (LLMOps). There are no tasks related to Macro-Category B (GenAI Specialization). This aligns with the definition of the Software Engineer profile, which requires tasks to be exclusively from Macro-Category A and not involve AI/ML integration.

confidence.reasoning: The job ad clearly outlines infrastructure and operations tasks, with no mention of AI/ML. The provided CODING_BOOK.md definitions for task categories and profiles are clear, allowing for a straightforward mapping. The 'Software Engineer' profile definition specifically accommodates roles exclusively in Macro-Category A without AI/ML involvement, making the assignment unambiguous.
